metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4932 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Multiple array index errors in epan/dissectors/packet-gsm_a_common.c in theGSM A Common dissector in Wireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.9 and 1.10.x before1.10.1 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (applicationcrash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4932` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark5 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap4 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil4 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
